reviews.review_msg: The grading schemes kept shift according to the pace of the course. Lectures are recorded. Assignments are detailed. Communicate if you have questions or issues with assignment. Would also give an extension, if needed. You can easily get an B+/A if you follow instructions and do the submissions on time. Enjoyed the class
Never take this professors class. Awful classes and simply awful grading practices
Worst professor I have ever come across. He acts really nice and screws the student. Lot of favoritism. Worst class i have been to. Teaching is really poor as well. Wish I had not taken his class
easy stuff but the prof's very disorganized and not very good at teaching in general. i'd recommend to take this course tho as a gpa booster.
Most disorganized prof ever! He's a great prof tho, really knows what he is talking about. Almost like a student as he procrastinates so much . Final was hard.
Amazingly funny and very knowledgeable. Great at explaining concepts and ideas and is very patient. Really helpful outside of class as well. An amazing teacher in every way.

Generally Ted is a very good professor however he's very disorganize. He procrastinates at the same level as a normal university student, so our group project was being written up while we're doing it. Also because of the time crunch a lot of the project was done by Ted and we wrote very little code. Great experience overall.

Ted seemed to always be behind schedule in terms of topics and assignments. This made the first few weeks fairly slow and lacking in content and the latter half was basically a rush to get things done on time.  To be fair, he tries his  best to answer any questions and is always open to feedback.

He's big on C++, so if you don't know it, then get ready for lots of work. He tried hard to make the class do-able for non-C++ students, but I still found it difficult. It was his first time teaching 225 (Fall 2015). 225 shouldn't be difficult if you study well. Textbook is your friend. And GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! He'll help you.

A great instructor - keeps class interested, hilarious if you share his sense of humour. Assignments are a bit long, but not at all difficult if you start early. Negatives: goes on tangents when students ask questions, could give more review material. Assignments took forever to mark, but fast exam marking more than compensated.

cmpt474 is still in course design stage. Assignments were not defined until very late in the semester. The prof and TA had to program more than all the students in order to setup assignment environments. Group processes consumed 23 of assignment time while most of the other 13 in his office asking for assignment requirement clarification.

He's very disorganized, and doesn't really know where the course is headed. Extremely unclear instructions. Scarce feedback. Irrelevant lectures. Save your money, and learn AWS on your own (unless you need this course for grad).
Chipper, helpful but quite disorganized.  I spent a lot of time with the textbook on my own to get through the course.

Very good at clarifying questions. The first half of the course goes by too slowly and the second half is done very quickly so if you have a lot of trouble at the beginning this may not be the course for you.

Prof is helpful during his office hour, really wants you to figure out for yourself how to solve your problem while giving little hints. Lectures are a little boring but informative, bring a coffee to keep awake. Nice professor, will miss him.
He's a good, fair professor. A bit disorganized but lectures are still interesting and he's clearly very knowledgeable in the material.

Very accessible and very generous with his time in office hours. He's well-spoken and also more well-rounded in his knowledge than most cmpt profs. Interesting fellow who made the most of fairly dull material. Doesn't work off slides, takes criticism well--it was his first time teaching the class.  Would definitely take another class with him.

Fun/interesting prof, although he was unorganized at times. It was also annoying to not have a textbook, not very used to HAVING to attend lectures and take notes these days. I actually feel like I learned some very important principles pertaining to user interfaces - but for the amount of content in this course,it could have been taught in a month

This class is easy as long as you keep you and know what you're doing. His lectures are boring. He gave only 1 assignment before the midterm and 5 assignments due before the final. Unfair marking. Gave 5 questions on the midterm that he DID NOT cover in lectures, then only gave 2.6 more marks. UNFAIR FINAL GRADE! I deserved WAY BETTER.
Great lectures, no textbook needed.
lecture is ok, but the final grade is really unfair!!! For example, he gives B when you actually can get A. Do not expect a high grade from him.
nice guy, easy course

unbelievable! how can students recommend this lecturer for this course? Yes, he may be intrested in the course, but he lacks ability to transfer knowledge: unprepared & boring lectures, difficult exams on easy content; taking this course with him is a GREAT mistake for a serious student cos it does not matter if you work hard or not.Take my advice!
Nice guy, very easy course, but very slow. The only imperfect thing is that he never gives feedback and comments on homework.
Interesting class. Very easy for someone who can speak english. Oh yeah and he is a SUPER slowwww marker!

A nice guy, however the class was very disorganized. The marking is EXTREMELY slow. Don't count on your drafts being used for the final papers. Feedback is little to none. The marks seem like they were picked out of a hat and given. It's like "hey this paper looks good you can have an A, but this paper sucks so you can have a D".

It's "Writing for Computer Scientists."  The class is going to be painful for any computing student.  That being said, he does a good job to make it tolerable and hey, no tests.  However.. SLOWEST MARKER EVER.  The last assignment was due 2 weeks ago, and as of this point we have 2 out of 8 assignments marked.

This prof is poorly organized. More than a couple of times he showed up to lecture saying "there's no lecture 'cause I haven't prepared". Assts and tests are given back very slowly (got first assignment more than halfway into the semester). Marking seems random and he can't even explain what's going to be on the test.
there have to be better than this guy for this course

went to class once every other week just studied notes from first 2 weeks and got an A. hes boring to listen to very repetetive not prepared, and his example lack imaginaiton. whole course spent criticizing websites. lame but good for those who need gpa boost they give him lot of good reviews here!

This was the easiest course I've ever taken at SFU.  But mostly that was because I was already pretty interested in interface design and Ted's passion for the subject made me even more interested.  If you're going to take this class you couldn't find anyone better to teach it.

Glad I didn't take a REAL cmpt course with this guy, he's very low on talent - not even close to the esteem of other profs.  I dreaded every moment of class with him because he just doesn't seem to say anything of meaning.  The course was very easy but unfairly marked.  Work hard or don't work at all and you'll still get the same grade.

He makes sure you really understand concepts through assignments that make you apply things you've learnt in class. This is not a course where you memorise and spit out. It's one you digest. His style of teaching may not be pleasing to some because he seems scattered at times, but he sure bent on you learning!

This class is mostly writing and a lot of imagination.  No programming... if you can write a decent essay then you shouldn't have problems in this class.  Textbook is boring... prof makes it a bit more interesting with real world examples and an interesting group project.

Sometimes unorganized, but a good prof. Lots of in-class practise, which is the best way to learn this material (practice, review, evaluate eachothers' work). Nice guy, great UI anecdotes. Always concerned about the 'UI' of the classroom! ("Can you see that there? Is that too bright/blurry/dark/small?") :)
I'd agree with previous comments that he is unorganised. He kept on changing the evaluation criteria which was the most frustrating part of the course. Kind of picky on things!
No Comments

Very unorganized. Frequently came to class unprepared. Class average was very high up until the final exam. Did not follow his initial schedule. Assignments were not graded in a timely fashion. Good personality but bad lecturing skills!!!
Easy contents but hard exams.
Gotta be the worst class in Cmpt Sci.
Gotta be the easiest class in Cmpt Sci
